title: For Sale/Trade:  Mosin-Nagant more rare Hungarian 48.M
postcontent: The rifle is a part of European military history. This is the rarest of all M44 variants only made between 1952 and 1953 with the Hungarian Rakosi Crest dated 1953. This is a Mosin-Nagant Hungarian referred to as the 48.M made in Hungary. 7.62x54mm bearing the Hungary Warsaw pact factory marking of '02' with matching serial numbers. Hungary was pressured through the Warsaw Pact to purchase the license from the Soviet Union for the manufacturer of this Mosin-Nagant. Production seems to have been limited to good quality copies. A samaller number of quality copies of the Russian M1891/30 were manufactured and referred to as a 48.M -model 48. It comes with a permantly installed original folding bayonet. This rifle is being priced to sell 'as is' w/o warrantees expressed or implied. As with all antique military rifles, these must be inspected by a qualified gunsmith before ever attempting to fire one of these weapons. The price is 275.00 and seller agrees to pay shipping FFL to FFL. Will send more detailed pictures upon request. Will sell in store pick-up for 250.00. Contact John at REDACTED or REDACTED

 •Slide cut and threaded for optional electronic red-dot sight (not included)
 •Raised night sights for suppressor use

BARREL
 •Cold hammer-forged, stainless steel
 •Polished chamber and feed ramp
 •Threaded 0.578x28 tpi with thread protector

FRAME
 •Polymer construction with replaceable steel frame/slide rails
 •Two interchangeable backstraps with lanyard eyelets
 •MIL-STD 1913 accessory mounting rail
 •Serrated trigger guard

OPERATING CONTROLS
 •Fully-ambidextrous decocking/safety levers, slide stop lever and magazine release

MAGAZINE
 •Polished body
 •Low-friction follower
 •Polymer base

SIGHTS
 •Fixed 3-dot night
 •Includes two mounting bases for optional red-dot electronic sights

•Caliber: .45 ACP
•Operation: Double-action/Single-action
•Magazine: 15 rds.
•Weight: 33.3 oz. (empty)
•Barrel Length: 5.3″ (with .578x28 RH barrel end thread pattern)
•Overall Length: 7.9″
•Sights: Fixed 3-dot night
•Made in the USA

Improving on the FNP™-45 Tactical, developed for the U.S. Joint Combat Pistol Program, the FNX™-45 Tactical is the latest in technological advancements in handgun engineering, offering .45 ACP performance and a host of unique features that no other handgun can match.  The checkered polymer frame is offered in Black and Flat Dark Earth and has a low-bore axis for reduced felt recoil and enhanced operator control.  Two interchangeable backstraps come standard to quickly customize the grip feel.  All operating controls are fully ambidextrous for ease of use.  The 5.3″ cold hammer-forged, stainless steel barrel has a threaded muzzle to accept sound suppressors, compensators and other accessories.  The stainless steel slide has high-profile combat night sights and includes two mounting bases to accept multiple styles of optional red-dot electronic sights.

Must have a valid State of Ohio id and be able to purchase or possess a firearm.  Must be over 21 years old.  Also, no person with any drug conviction, as well as any person convicted of a felony and those who have been convicted of certain misdemeanor crimes of violence.

title: For Sale:  Classic Remington 700 BDL in 6MM - Price Reduced to Sell
postcontent:
Rare, pristine Remington 700 BDL in 6mm for sale. Includes leather sling, Leupold 2X7 Vari –XII scope, Weaver sight rings, and immaculate, padded Ted Williams soft case. It was made in April of 1964, purchased in the late 60’s and hardly, if ever, used. It is clean and crisp as anything you’ve ever seen; a very sweet piece. The whole package is original, and could have just been brought home from the store.

We would prefer to keep it in the family, but one of our sons was selected for a band/choir concert tour in Europe, and we’re short the last chunk for the trip.

It’s a great gun for a collection or for a young person. My Father-in-Law said it’s an amazing, flat shooter. Research indicates it’s great for game up to and including deer.
If you think you’d like it, let me know quickly. I reduced the price from $1250 based on some input from a collector. This is fair for everything together. I think it will go fast. If I’m wrong, and we don’t make the deadline (1 Feb), it’s going off the market.

title: For Sale:  Fully Customized Reminton 700 LTR Sniper Weapon System.
location: Bullhead AZ But will ship US wide., Arizona, United States
postcontent:
The rifle is a Remington 700 LTR which is Light Tactical Rifle. it is in .308. It has a full barrel length fluting. 20" barrel, 12/1 twist. 1/4 MOA shot placement at 100 meters. Harmonized, crowned barrel and tuned adjustable trigger system.
The PD stated that was the scope I had to have if I was going to be a sniper on the swat team because the army uses Leupold MK4. So I ordered it for over $1k and found out I bought a clone worth about $300. lol But I put it on and we put 5 sniper challenge coins out at the 100 Meter mark and plugged all of them 1st shot. It is really nice. Im more of a schmitt and bender guy but its what they required. It works well. Obj. Lens Diameter: 1.575in / 40mm -Field of View @100 yds (ft): 29.5(3.5x) 10.7(10x) 
It has a filled out scope dope for the low mount so you dont have to spend a ton of time figuring out your click adjustments. two dope charts. One is in the scope cap, the other is taped to the stock for quick reference. Everything is top quality with no expense spared. I built it wile working a side job as a gunsmith at a gun store. So it is professionally put together. If you want it I will take the transfer charge and shipping out of it and get a low priced case to ship it in. I added butler creek scope caps. I added a sun screen to protect against scope flash. It is on quick detach rings, It has a cheap $75 back up site for close quarters getting to the hide. It has a bubble marker for extreme Long range. I put 15 rounds down range at 1,000 and 1,2000 meters and still worked great. Hence it having a high mount on it right now. I have a low mount if you want it too for the 100 and 200 ranges. It also has a angle cosign indicator mounted on the left side to not interfere with the ejections. These are for shooting from high to low or vice versa. You will find them on almost all sniper rifles in Afghanistan.
The Bi pod is a versa pod on a anschutz T rail running the entire length of the for grip of the rifle. This helps you move the bipod or accessories where ever you want on the rifle. Versa pod is a 6" sniper model swiveling, locking and extendable. It comes with the T rail mount not a bead mount. Which is the little eye hole like a hunting rifle that a lower quality bipods attach to, however it has that also for preference.
 The stock is Bell & Carlson Tactical Medalist Style 5 Fully Adjustable 3-way adjustable butt assembly that adjusts for: length of pull; cant (left/right butt tilt); and height (up/down); adjustable cheek piece for precise cheek/eye placement to scope; Wide & Flat forend for bench / bag stability; Anschutz-style forend rail (attaches accessories such as bipods, grips, etc.) a aluminum bedding block, not glass. The stock is Olive drab with black spider webbing for added camouflage. The stock features a Wyatt brand M4 detachable 10 rnd box magazine. Uncle mikes sling rings quick detachable. The sling itself is a 1.5 inch wide black DPMS harness grade leather latch sling made to be used as a 1 point sling or two point sling. The one point is used a tourniquet to stabilize the rifle. Sort of like when you grip the sling to stabilize the rifle but in this case it wraps around your arm and hooks in place so it doesnt need to be held.
The writing on the side is vinyl decal that can be removed. I am sure you dont want Officer McCoy on there. It comes off easy.
I also have a speed grip for the bolt. I just have not put it on the gun yet because I dont like explaining things to metal workers.
Matte Black finish -Target style adjustment knobs -1/4 MOA windage and elevation adjustments with 15-MOA of adjustment for each revolution -Fully multicoated lenses for unsurpassed light transmission/contrast -Illuminated Mil-dot reticle (11 brightness level) Red/Green -Nitrogen filled -100% Waterproof/Fogproof/Shockproof -Actual Magnification: 3.3(3.5x) 9.6(10x) -Length(in): 13.8 -Objective Diameter(in): 1.83 -Eyepiece Diameter(in): 1.55 -Weight: 630 grams -Eye Relief (mm): 117(3.5x) 91(10x) -
It has about $3,500 + in it. It is practically brand new. I believe $3,500 is fair but willing to negotiate. Im in a spot so I can negotiate but I think $3000 is the right price. I wouldn’t sell it if I didnt need to move and that costs.
This is the stock rifle. Note the price of msrp. lol Then compare it to the price Im asking for.
"IN STOCK" Remington LE 700 Police LTR (Light Tactical Rifle)
www.oaklandtactical.com
IN STOCK Remington LE 700 Police LTR (Light Tactical Rifle) -Remington LE 700 LTRs in 308 Win. 20 Fluted Barrel, Remington 40X trigger.

title: For Trade:  AR 15 Project *ALL NEW, UNFIRED PARTS*****SALE PENDING***
location: So. King Co., Washington, United States
postcontent:
****SALE PENDING***Up for possible trade I have a nearly complete AR-15 project. All it needs is a rear sight, the bolt carrier group & charging handle. The lower is a complete LW-15 from New Frontier Armory. The upper is a standard flat top, with an ESS 16" chrome moly barrel w/ a med. contour, similar to an M4. It has a 1 in 7 rate of twist, phosphate finish, bird cage style flash hider and is chambered for 5.56 NATO. Has a taper pinned factory A2 front sight, standard carbine length gas system, and standard M4 hand guards. Both the upper and lower where brand new before being mounted together and neither one has seen a single round fired yet. Also I must mention that the polymer lower is a very nice, tight fit for this upper with practically no play at all. I had my doubts about these lowers before my first build with one but it is still going strong after approx. 1,500rds and has not shown any signs of breaking down yet. They have some pretty good torture tests on the companies website if you are curious to see one in use. Granted it is from the company that manufactures them but still gives you a decent idea at least.

Anyways, it comes with one new 30rd mag which is also unfired and would make a great entry level AR for someone. I'm just short the last couple parts needed to complete it and can't really justify to the wife investing money in another AR right now so I'm testing the waters to see if I can't get another handgun in trade to enjoy with the family. Sorry for the poor pic quality. I will try to get some better ones up soon and could send some as well if there is anything in particular you would like a better look at. 

I will only deal in person, face to face. No mailing or any of that type of stuff. All I ask is that you be legal to own, a WA state resident, and be willing to show a state ID (preferably a drivers license).

title: For Sale/Trade:  YOUR REPS IN CONCORD WANT TO BAN PRIVATE GUN SALES
postcontent:
ACTION ALERT !

HB 1589 Hearing - Tuesday, January 21 - 1:15 PM

 COME FIGHT THE WORST ANTI-GUN NH LEGISLATION OF THE YEAR -
  BANNING PRIVATE GUN SALES

As we warned in an earlier article on the Pro-Gun New Hampshire website, www.PGNH.org, state representative E. Elaine Andrews-Ahearn (D - North Hampton)( See pic Below) has filed a bill to ban private sales of all firearms -- rifles, shotguns, handguns -- in New Hampshire, forcing them to go through a licensed dealer (FFL).  Violation would be a FELONY.  PRO-GUN NEW HAMPSHIRE URGES ALL NH GUN OWNERS TO EXPRESS THEIR OPINIONS OF THIS BILL, HB 1589, TO THE MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE COMMERCE AND CONSUMER AFFAIRS COMMITTEE, AND TO ATTEND THE PUBLIC HEARING: Tuesday, January 21, 2014, at 1:15 p.m.   Because the legislature knows that this bill will infuriate gun owners, the hearing is scheduled not for the small committee room but for REPRESENTATIVES HALL in the State House.



This bill is a state-level version of last year's failed effort to do the same thing at the federal level, namely universal background checks, which we wrote about earlier.  (See the website http://www.noubc.com.)  The statement within HB 1589 that it's not gun registration is laughable; every gun transfer through a licensed dealer is recorded, and it's certain that registration will follow.  As has been proven all over the world, over and over, sooner or later registration leads to confiscation.

The text of the bill can be read at
http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/legislation/2014/HB1589.html .

It's interesting that the Speaker of the House has scheduled this bill to be heard by the NH House Commerce and Consumer Affairs Committee instead of the Criminal Justice and Public Safety Committee, which has jurisdiction over gun bills.

Go to http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/house/committees/committeedetails.aspx?code=H43 to see the committee members.  While you can click on the link titled "Email Committee Members" to send a message to the committee office, it's better to click on the name of each member to get their individual email address.  Paper mail to a home address is more effective than email, however, and the committee page includes a link,
http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/house/committees/CommitteeMailingList.aspx?code=H43 , with the mailing address of each committee member.  In addition, you can contact the  bill's sponsors, as listed in the text of the bill, through the House Roster, at
http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/house/members/memberlookup.aspx, and the Senate Roster, at
http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/Senate/members/senate_roster.aspx.  PLEASE BE CIVIL in your mail and messsages!  PGNH members, please remember our bylaws' Statement of Principles, which calls for mature and honorable conduct.

At the hearing, you can fill out a "pink card" if you want to speak, or sign the "blue sheet" to say if you support or oppose the bill but don't want to speak.  If you plan to testify, keep your time (which you list on the pink card) very short (no more than three minutes) unless you want to wait all afternoon to be called.  If you attend the hearing, especialy if you plan to testify, we recommend you go early, as we expect Reps Hall to be packed.  Note that no firearms are allowed in Reps Hall or adjacent areas of the State House.

THIS BILL MUST BE DEFEATED.

***Bill sponsors email  REDACTED    

****Interesting Fact is Rep. Elaine was born and raised mainly in Gloucester, Massachusetts and then spent her high school years in the United Kingdom

postcontent:
I have a family friend who makes knives as a hobby.  He has been doing this for 20+ years.  He does everything from start to finish himself.  He starts with a solid 1/8 thick piece of 1660 stainless steel and grinds it into the shape he desires.  

Around Christmas he got hard up for cash.  I told him I would just loan him some cash, but he said he would rather just sell me a few of his hand made knives at a drastically reduced rate from how much he typically gets.  So I have 4 knives for sale.  I have no need for them.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Loser Gouging People
postcontent:
Below e-mail was sent to me by the loser trying to gouge people on the Anderson stripped lower:

"Why can't we have a free market here to try and sell things for what ever price we want? If some guy wants to list things for more than they are worth, then let him. No one will contact him, and he won't sell it. The crap you have listed is all over the internet too at less than you're asking. How would you like someone to post an ad every time you did blasting your stuff. Do you go hang signs on the doors of dealers and pawn shops whose prices are higher telling people to go elsewhere. No, because it's their stuff and they can sell it for whatever they want. Just sell your stuff, contact people about the stuff you're interested in, and leave everyone else alone."

If you're buying, know your local prices (like I quote in my listings, if available locally).

If you're selling, don't try to gouge people.  If you paid more for something than it's worth, don't try to screw the next guy over (all my items are listed below local gun store prices).

And if someone calls you out on being a gouger, man up, learn you lesson and stop being a schmuck!

THE AR PLATFORM REDEFINED. The SR-556® offers Ruger's legendary rugged reliability, and comes factory standard with a host of accessories that today's shooters demand.
